sanskrit_verse:
त्यजेदाश्वयुजे मासि मुन्यन्नं पूर्वसञ्चितम् ।
जीर्णानि चैव वासांसि शाकमूलफलानि च ॥ ६.१५॥
transliteration:
tyajed āśvayuje māsi munyannaṁ pūrvasañcitam |
jīrṇāni caiva vāsāṁsi śākamūlaphalāni ca || 6.15||
sph_interpretive_translation: In the month of Ashvayuja, one must discard previously stored food, worn-out garments, and old roots, vegetables, and fruits.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority flows from timely alignment with natural cycles
Causation arises from maintaining purity in material engagement
Capacity-based responsibility includes conscious release of accumulated matter
Restoration logic operates through periodic detachment from past acquisitions
Consciousness alignment requires abandonment of what obstructs renewal
executable_legal_axioms: IF current_month = Ashvayuja THEN initiate discard_protocol FOR stored_non_sattvic_food_items
IF garment_condition = 'jirna' THEN execute_replacement_sequence WITH conscious_disposal
IF possession_type IN [old_roots, stale_fruits, wilted_vegetables] AND retention_time > seasonal_threshold THEN trigger_release_mechanism
supreme_court_application: At the Supreme Court level, this directive establishes a threshold of environmental and personal hygiene compliance where failure to periodically divest from deteriorating possessions reflects diminished capacity for self-governance and indicates misalignment with dharmic order requiring judicial restoration rather than punitive action.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramana reveals that decayed substances cause subtle impurity; anupurvasah shows how retention perpetuates imbalance; proportional responsibility lies in recognizing seasonal cleansing as duty; non-punitive reality rule confirms that release restores clarity without inflicting suffering.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate guided disposal process under spiritual supervision
Assign completion task to ensure full relinquishment of expired materials
Implement awareness protocol to prevent future accumulation beyond utility
Reintegrate individual into sattvic environment through purification sequences
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this directive originates not as command but as expression of eternal Dharma; justice is served through restoration, not punishment; consciousness alone is the final adjudicator.
